Class Function

  • java.lang.Object
    • Function
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Negation, Polynomial, Power, TwoFunction

    public abstract class Function
extends java.lang.Object
    A mathematical function with mathematical methods.

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double bisectionMethod​(double a, double b)
      Finds the root of the function in a given interval [a, b] using the Bisection method within a 10^-5 error term.
      double bisectionMethod​(double a, double b, double epsilon)
      Finds the root of the function in a given interval [a, b] using the bisection method within the given error term.
      abstract Function derivative​()
      Calculates the derivative of the function.
      double newtonRaphsonMethod​(double a)
      Finds the root of the function in the neighborhood of a given point using the Newton-Raphson method within a 10^-5 error term.
      double newtonRaphsonMethod​(double a, double epsilon)
      Finds the root of the function in the neighborhood of a given point using the Newton-Raphson method within the given error term.
      Polynomial taylorPolynomial​(int n)
      Calculates the Taylor (Maclaurin) polynomial of a given order for the function.
      abstract java.lang.String toString​()
      Creates a string representation of the function.
      abstract double valueAt​(double x)
      Calculates the function value at given x coordinate.

      • bisectionMethod

        public final double bisectionMethod​(double a,
                                    double b,
                                    double epsilon)
        Finds the root of the function in a given interval [a, b] using the bisection method within the given error term. Assumptions: The function is continuous on the interval [a, b]. f(a)*f(b) is negative. The interval [a, b] contains exactly 1 root.
        Parameters:
        a - left endpoint
        b - right endpoint
        epsilon - error term
        Returns:
        root of the function in interval

      • bisectionMethod

        public final double bisectionMethod​(double a,
                                    double b)
        Finds the root of the function in a given interval [a, b] using the Bisection method within a 10^-5 error term. Assumptions: The function is continuous on the interval [a, b]. f(a)*f(b) is negative. The interval [a, b] contains exactly 1 root.
        Parameters:
        a - left endpoint
        b - right endpoint
        Returns:
        root of the function in interval

      • newtonRaphsonMethod

        public final double newtonRaphsonMethod​(double a,
                                        double epsilon)
        Finds the root of the function in the neighborhood of a given point using the Newton-Raphson method within the given error term. The Newton-Raphson method defines a sequence of points that converges to the root of the function.
        Parameters:
        a - point to find root around
        epsilon - error term
        Returns:
        root of the function in neighborhood of point

      • newtonRaphsonMethod

        public final double newtonRaphsonMethod​(double a)
        Finds the root of the function in the neighborhood of a given point using the Newton-Raphson method within a 10^-5 error term. The Newton-Raphson method defines a sequence of points that converges to the root of the function.
        Parameters:
        a - point to find root around
        Returns:
        root of the function in neighborhood of point

      • taylorPolynomial

        public final Polynomial taylorPolynomial​(int n)
        Calculates the Taylor (Maclaurin) polynomial of a given order for the function.
        Parameters:
        n - order of Taylor polynomial
        Returns:
        Taylor polynomial of the function
